results.title: Struggle for oil
results.creator_credit: Sydney Newman, ONF | NFB and Ronald Dick
results.brief_description: The story of the development of the oil resources of the Canadian prairies and how their discovery is affecting the economy of the West. A gusher gone wild, oil crews working feverishly around the clock, oil barons conferring in plush board rooms, the Alberta pipeline, Edmonton’s neon nightlife - these are the glimpses the film shows of how oil is taking its place with agriculture, bringing a new industrial prosperity. Despite the inexhaustible appearance of Alberta’s oil wells, scientists are looking farther north, to the far sands of Athabaska where still greater deposits wait to be released.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sydney Newman, ONF | NFB and Ronald Dick

results.title: Struggle for China: the story of the Chinese revolution (D)
results.brief_description: Using a wide variety of material drawn from Archives including propaganda material filmed by American, Chinese Communist, Nationalist and Japanese cameramen, this film reconstructs events in China from 1900-1949, one of the bloodiest and most turbulent periods in history. Narrated by James Mason. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB

results.title: Structuring the learning environment (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Discusses four key points concerning the learning environment for severely and profoundly retarded students: the normalisation model; a ten point plan for increasing behaviour; the reasons why inappropriate behaviours occur; handling disruptive students

results.title: Structure within the image
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Photographers Barbara Kasten and Garry Winogrand show how every photographer uses a unique structure within their work. Discusses framing, line, shape, tone and pattern and demonstrates ways to structurally improve photographs.

results.title: Structure of the atom
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
These programs explore the history and development of the model of the atom, from the hypothesis of early Greek philosophers to the wave-mechanical model of modern atomic physicists. Experiments by pioneer atomic scientists such as Bohr, Faraday, de Broglie and Rutherford are recreated through animation and their implications are discussed. The six 10 minute episodes are: 1. “The Earliest models” 2. “Smaller than smallest” 3. “The Rutherford Model” 4. “The Bohr Model” 5. “Spectra” 6.”The Wave-mechanic Model.”
